 From: Edward Young <nu=
shi.com@...>
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
Sent: Monday, January =
7, 2013 7:08 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] WWII vet bring back
 

=C2=A0 
I ha=
ve recently acquired a WWII Trophy, a WWII Veteran bring back Tanto.

This =
 Japanese Tanto may be of the Osoraku Zukuri blade form. It was found
on th=
e body of Commander Goichi Oya (Commander of Japanese forces on Tinian
Isla=
nd during WW II), who committed Seppuku in a cave on the Island during
the =
US invasion. The body and the Tanto were found by a US Marine named
Fred Os=
good who was awarded the Bronze Star and a Purple Heart. He sent the
Tanto =
home in 1944 after the action on Tinian Island, and it was in his
possessio=
n since his return from the war until November of 2012 when it
came into my=
 possession.

The Tanto is 13 1/16" long with 3 3/8" being the Nakago (As m=
easured from
the Tsuba notch). It is 0.229" thick just in front of the notc=
h. The Nakago
tapers to 0.115 at it's end (See attached file image).

At th=
is point I am wondering if any one has more information on this
particular,=
 or type of,  Tanto.

What I have found so far is that Commander Giochi Oya=
 was A Commander in
the Imperial Japanese Navy, and Commander of the IJN 56=
th guard Unit, with
his head Quarters at Mt. Lasso, Tinian Island. He was r=
esponsible for the
defenses of the four air fields on Tinian Island. There =
on Tinian Island he
committed Seppuku  August 2, 1944.

Thanks in advance f=
or any information available,

Ed.
